intro: Erycibe obtusifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved erycibe, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruits are fleshy capsules that contain numerous small seeds. Erycibe obtusifolia is often found in moist, shaded areas within tropical forests.
